diagnosis.final_diagnosis: P450scc deficiency due to novel homozygous L222P mutation in CYP11A1 gene
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Defect of steroidogenic acute regulatory protein (StAR)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with ambiguous genitalia and adolescent-onset adrenal insufficiency, consistent with partial P450scc deficiency. Diagnostic workup, including hormonal profiling and mutational analysis, revealed a homozygous L222P mutation in CYP11A1, correlating with reduced enzymatic activity. Elevated ACTH levels and deficiencies in certain steroid hormones further supported the diagnosis.
